alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; Claiborne; De Soto; Red River; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 02 at 7:44PM CDT until April 02 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Webster Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Northern De Soto Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Northern Red River Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Caddo Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Southwestern Claiborne Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Western Bienville Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Bossier Parish in northwestern Louisiana... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 743 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Oil City to near Blanchard to near Greenwood to near Deberry, moving east at 50 mph. The largest hail is associated with the southwest flank of the storm along the Harrison and Panola County line, and will affect mainly rural areas in Southwest Caddo Parish and Northern Desoto Parish. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Minden, Haughton, Greenwood, Blanchard, Benton, Stonewall, Ringgold, Sibley, Cotton Valley, Oil City, Doyline, Mooringsport, Dixie Inn, Dubberly, Belcher, Heflin, Gilliam and Eastwood. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These are dangerous storms. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to shelter inside a strong building, and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; Claiborne; De Soto; Red River; Webster
